intro: Kickxia gombaultii, commonly known as the Gombault's bellflower, is a flowering plant native to the Mediterranean region. It belongs to the Campanulaceae family and is characterized by its bell-shaped flowers that range in color from blue to purple. The plant typically grows in rocky or gravelly soils and is often found in dry, sunny habitats. It has narrow, grass-like leaves and produces small, clustered flowers during the summer months. Due to its specific habitat requirements, it is considered a rare and endangered species in many parts of its range.
